subclusters.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Inheritance Theory
Declining Antioxidant Defense and Redox Homeostasis Theory
Extracellular Matrix Remodeling and Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Longevity Theory
Damage Load and Asymmetric Damage Partitioning Evolutionary Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on tetraploidy-induced chromosomal instability, aneuploidy, and cGAS-STING activation linking chromosomal missegregation to aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of chromosomal damage such as micronuclei and chromosomal aberrations causing genomic instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes RecQ helicase disorders causing genome instability and defective DNA repair leading to premature aging, linking chromosomal instability to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains evolutionary cancer resistance via natural selection shaping tumor suppressor mechanisms, related to chromosomal instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links aging to asymmetric segregation of damaged protein aggregates and DNA damage under stress, contributing to cellular senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extranuclear DNA accumulation activating cGAS-STING pathway causing inflammation and senescence, a downstream effect of chromosomal damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage-control biosystem managing mutation accumulation and genomic instability, linking DNA damage to aging and cancer risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA interstrand crosslink accumulation causing progenitor cell senescence and systemic aging, a form of chromosomal DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links genomic instability and DNA replication defects in progeroid syndromes to aging, emphasizing nuclear DNA maintenance and chromosomal stability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromosomal Instability and Aneuploidy-Driven DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Topoisomerase 2-mediated DNA double strand breaks causing genome instability and aging, a direct chromosomal DNA damage mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of DNA damage due to decline in base excision repair capacity, specifically DNA polymerase beta, leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General DNA damage accumulation theory emphasizing imperfect repair and accumulation of DNA lesions causing cellular dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits DNA damage accumulation impairs genomic integrity and promotes pathological protein accumulation, linking nuclear DNA damage to aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA damage accumulation and impaired repair accelerating aging, supported by lifespan extension via DNA protection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes differential impact of various DNA lesions and their repair on aging, focusing on nuclear DNA damage and cellular context.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Repair Decline and Base Excision Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage and the role of nucleotide excision repair and base excision repair pathways in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Inheritance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mitochondrial DNA mutations due to reduced effective population size and uniparental inheritance affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Inheritance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genome robustness to mutational signatures, including mitochondrial mutagenesis, linking mutation tolerance to longevity and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Inheritance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Molecular damage accumulation theory including mitochondrial ROS-induced damage to DNA and other biomolecules contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Inheritance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General molecular damage accumulation theory encompassing DNA, proteins, and metabolites, including mitochondrial damage in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Declining Antioxidant Defense and Redox Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in Nrf2-MafS signaling reducing antioxidant defense, leading to oxidative damage accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Declining Antioxidant Defense and Redox Homeostasis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in adaptive homeostasis with age, including impaired Nrf2-Keap1 pathway function, reducing stress response and promoting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Matrix Remodeling and Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes dauer-independent reduced insulin/IGF-1 signaling promoting longevity via SKN-1 and extracellular matrix remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Load and Asymmetric Damage Partitioning Evolutionary Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes damage load accumulation and evolution of asymmetrical damage transmission during cell division as a cause of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Load and Asymmetric Damage Partitioning Evolutionary Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of damaged cell constituents and asymmetric cell division or vesicle-mediated damage removal as rejuvenation mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Extracellular Matrix Remodeling and Insulin/IGF-1 Signaling Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormonal regulation of longevity via dafachronic acid and DAF-12 nuclear receptor, linking endocrine signaling to lifespan.
